title: Coronation Street spoilers: Daniel leaves the street after Sinead dies
text:
A world without Sinead Tinker (Katie McGlynn) is something Daniel Osbourne (Rob Mallard) is forced to come to terms with in Coronation Street, and — during the upcoming episodes — the young man struggles to remain in the street as a result, and thus he makes plans to get away for a while.

Following Sinead’s death, Daniel is left to organise the funeral — something which he struggles to do, and thus demands that everyone else leaves him alone.

Later, he pays a visit to the corner shop, and is horrified to find Evelyn (Maureen Lipman) baiting Bethany, so he rushes to her defence. Beth (Lisa George) hears about what happened and she’s fuming.

She later finds Bethany comforting an upset Daniel in Victoria Gardens and, with emotions running high, she accuses him of having an affair with Bethany, commenting how Sinead isn’t even cold yet.

Afterwards, Daniel stops by Ken’s (William Roache) and announces that he’s taking Bertie away on holiday to Scotland on the basis that it’ll do both him and his child the world of good to get away from the street for a little while.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Adam (Sam Robertson) and Peter (Chris Gascoyne) voice their concerns, but Daniel is adamant that this is what’s best for everyone involved.

As the pair set off for Scotland, an upset Beth watches on, and she’s worried that she’ll never see her godson again.

Will Daniel return to the street?

One to watch: Monday 28th October at 8:30pm on ITV.

Advertisement Advertisement
description: Is Daniel planning on leaving for good?
